document_data.caption: A map showing the City of the Gods in Skuld outlined in red.
document_data.name: City of the Gods
document_data.mainbody: The '''City of the Gods''' was a sacred section of the capital city of [[Skuld]] in [[Mulhorand]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite interactive atlas|490 Skuld}} Following the city's destruction during the [[Spellplague]], the City of the Gods became a subject of legend in [[High Imaskar]].
document_data.Location: The City of the Gods was located in the northcentral section of the city.
document_data.Description: The entire district was walled, separating it from the rest of Skuld. The only entrance through the walls was through the [[Tower of Pronouncement]] located in the center of the southern wall. As its name implied, the City of the Gods housed the vast majority of temples devoted to the various [[god]]s of the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]]. [[Incarnation]]s of these gods often lived here as well in elaborate towers.
document_data.Notable Locations:
* [[Temple of Horus-Re (Skuld)|Temple of Horus-Re]]
* Tower of Pronouncement
* [[Pyramid of Re]]
* [[Tower of Isis]]
* [[Tower of Anhur]]
* [[Tower of Osiris]]
* [[Tower of Nephthys]]
* [[Towers of Thoth|Tower of Thoth]]
* [[Towers of Horus-Re|Tower of Horus-Re]]
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Post-Spellplague, legends told of its ruins containing incredible treasures that could be plundered, but also dire monsters and terrible traps.
